hilbert-layers.commenet: Multi-space breakdown for the guardrail middle phase
hilbert-layers.reference: Shared structure of H and C.

layer.space: H_obs = span of telemetry vectors emitted by guardrails-middle.
layer.constraint: Vectors normalized by Parseval identity to keep metrics bounded.
layer.projection: P_obs maps arbitrary state embeddings onto H_obs.

layer.space: H_pol = closure of feasible enforcement vectors.
layer.constraint: Convex due to averaging of enforcement packages.
layer.projection: P_pol ensures invariants by referencing guardrails-begin charter.

layer.space: H_inc = subspace generated by incident signatures (latency, drift, evasion).
layer.metric: d_inc derived from telemetry noise floor defined in continuum.xml.
layer.projection: P_inc used in guardrails-middle control loop detect stage.

layer.space: H_syn = H_obs ∩ H_pol, capturing actionable safe states.
layer.operator: Π_syn = P_pol ∘ P_obs = P_obs ∘ P_pol (projections commute on intersection).
layer.property: Fejér monotone sequence built from repeated Π_syn applications converges to C.

layer.space: H_rel = image of guardrails-end handshake under embedding E.
layer.property: Since guardrails-end preserves checksums, H_rel = fixed point set of P_pol.
